website_summaries.verdict: One of the few unisex drysuits available. Fits great for most body types.
pros: Cut for both male and female body types with reviews citing the suit is true to size
We love the details in design including a double-ended zipper to ease getting in and out of the suit
Designed to serve as a second layer for outdoor sports in near-freezing water temperatures
cons: The fabric may be a little too thin for some

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect 2nd layer. Or base layer for water around 46-65 degrees. My husband is 5"11 and 200lbs he got the large and it's a perfect fit. The best part is it has pockets. 3 of them. It only added a little extra buoyancy. Maybe a pond.
customer_reviews.author: Tloudmouth

customer_reviews.title: One More Size for Men
customer_reviews.text: It's thin and help to use as 2nd layer over clothes. I tested and I'm going to need to put more clothes next time due I did with tank top and shorts. This product fit me well though I use small size as man but this is unisex size, so I choose Medium and fit me well. I think this product need to show a size chart to prevent wrong size. Thanks for the size chart from another online shopping site, where I learned that unisex size is one more size for men due the combination of both gender.
customer_reviews.author: Jose V.

customer_reviews.title: Warm water drysuit use
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this pre dive. I bought this for warm water drysuit diving 50 - 72 degree water temps. It's not very thick seems like it's going to be comfortable to dive. I'll update my review post dive. Thermal cline is about 60 in 25 feet. Post dive review. This thing is perfect for summer diving In a dry suit in New England. Watch the size they run small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I returned due to sizing but the garment was quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain about the quality of the garment, but size chart isn't accurate. I am 6'2" on the nose, and the XL was listed as fitting me. It didnt, it was too short, fitting someone 6' comfortably imo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, we made
customer_reviews.text: A little lightweight for cold water diving but otherwise well made. Just wear another layer under it
customer_reviews.author: ash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and great quality, look and feel. Very comfortable and warm too! SEAC never disappoints
customer_reviews.author: OnTheWave

customer_reviews.title: Thin but warm
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is equivalent in thickness to a pair of long underwear. I got it because it reduces boyancy. Its comfortable and fits well but I would say min water temp of 55+.
customer_reviews.author: Avidreader1980

customer_reviews.title: i'll be comfortable now even with
customer_reviews.text: quality item but size i ordered was too small to accommodate any undergarments. i ordered one size larger of the same product. i'll be comfortable now even with undergarments
customer_reviews.author: RocKayak

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love diving with this item. I use it under my 7mil neoprene drysuit and it does a good job keeping heat in while moving water from the skin. Easy to don and easy to clean. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Flores

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on. Kept me warm. I’m 5 foot 11, 225 pounds and this was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Cristopher j.

customer_reviews.title: to thin to use by itself but it adds to a good pair of under armor
customer_reviews.text: It is a decent underwear but it is very thin see through thin, to thin to use by itself but it adds to a good pair of under armor.
customer_reviews.author: albert

customer_reviews.title: Great for divers!
customer_reviews.text: Not as thick as I was hoping but still aids in keeping me warm even at 70 feet under!
customer_reviews.author: The Great Mangini

customer_reviews.title: Water 38 degree's very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Wearing it under my dry suit for kite boarding. Water 38 degree's very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: H.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice base layer.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for a base layer while not costing too much
customer_reviews.author: Jak Crow

customer_reviews.title: It does not repell any water at all. None. Not even a mist.
customer_reviews.text: First off this does not come close to repelling any water. In fact all it does is keep more water in than out. Which in turn makes it colder than not wearing. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J DeRenzo

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-layer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mid-layer for cold water diving, or possibly as a single layer for warmer waters, definitely not going to be enough for low 50s upper 40s water temps. Description definitely needs updating, not water repellent as others have stated, and pockets don't have zippers. breast pocket does have velcro. none of this is a big deal as it is going to be inside a dry suit. Bottom line is it is worth the money (have you seen how expensive polar fleece garments are?) and I would recommend and buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Satan

product_meta.title: SEAC Unifleece Insulating Undergarment Dry Suit
product_meta.description: Wear the SEAC Drysuit Unifleece Insulating Undergarment under your drysuit to stay warm while diving in cold water. Made from soft, lightweight, breathable material with a water-repellant outer layer. Double-ended front zipper and ankle stirrups let you put on your drysuit without bunching. Carry extra gear in easy-access zippered pockets.
feature_bullets: Lightweight, breathable, 2-layer undergarment keeps you warm while diving in cold environments
Outer layer repels water to help keep you dry
Double-ended front zipper gets you in and out quickly
Ankle stirrups prevent bunching when putting on your drysuit
Easy-access zippered pockets for carrying extra gear
